citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A brown and white weanling guinea pig in pen 16 was observed with an eye abnormality and was in need of veterinary
care. The left eye was red with a white discharge and held partially closed. The right eye was red and bulging with a
circular yellow center. The facility had not observed the condition, had not contacted the attending veterinarian, and was
not administering any treatment.
Eye abnormalities can affect the vision, can be indicative of disease or injury, can be painful, and affect the overall health
and well-being of the animal.
The facility must contact the attending veterinarian to have the guinea pig with the eye abnormality evaluated in order to
determine an appropriate plan for diagnosis and treatment.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A brown and white weanling guinea pig in pen 16 was observed with an eye abnormality and was in need of veterinary 
care. The left eye was red with a white discharge and held partially closed. The right eye was red and bulging with a 
circular yellow center.  The facility had not observed the condition, had not contacted the attending veterinarian, and was 
not administering any treatment. 
Eye abnormalities can affect the vision, can be indicative of disease or injury, can be painful, and affect the overall health 
and well-being of the animal.   
The facility must contact the attending veterinarian to have the guinea pig with the eye abnormality evaluated in order to 
determine an appropriate plan for diagnosis and treatment. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
